lines.text: Pollution. Crime. Drugs, poverty, disease, hunger, despair - we throw GOBS of money at them and problems only get worse. Why is that? Because money's most powerful ability is to allow bad people to continue doing bad things at the expense of those who don't have it.
I agree. Now who did you say you were working for?
Oh, that's just my day job.
Carl?
The, young lady with the... Uzi. Is she single?
Uh, Carl? Excuse us.
[pulls Carl aside]
This is the brass ring. Haven't you got any bigger thoughts?
I just want her telephone number. Please?
Wait a minute... you can have anything you want, and you're asking for my phone number?
Yes.
I'm Carl.
I'm Mary.
I'm going to be sick!
I cannot kill my friend.
[to his henchmen]
Kill my friend.
This is my last computer date.
Wait. A computer matched *her* with *him*? I don't think so.
There I was in prison. And one day I helped a couple of nice older gentlemen make some free telephone calls. They turned out to be, let us say, good family men.
Organized crime?
Hah. Don't kid yourself. It's not that organized.
[each member of the team makes a request in return for the decryption chip]
I want peace on earth and goodwill toward man.
Oh, this is ridiculous.
He's serious.
I want peace on earth and goodwill toward men.
We are the United States Government! We don't do that sort of thing.
You're just gonna have to try.
All right, I'll see what I can do.
Thank you very much. That's all I ask.

There's a war out there, old friend. A world war. And it's not about who's got the most bullets. It's about who controls the information. What we see and hear, how we work, what we think... it's all about the information!
The world isn't run by weapons anymore, or energy, or money. It's run by little ones and zeroes, little bits of data. It's all just electrons.
National Security Agency.
Ah. You're the guys I hear breathing on the other end of my phone.
No, that's the FBI. We're not chartered for domestic surveillance.
Oh, I see. You just overthrow governments. Set up friendly dictators.
No, that's the CIA. We protect our government's communications, we try to break the other fella's codes. We're the good guys, Marty.
Gee, I can't tell you what a relief that is... Dick.
So it's a code breaker.
No. It's THE code breaker. No more secrets...
You know, I could have been in the NSA, but they found out my parents were married.
[Wallace goes after him, menacing]
People think a bank might be financially shaky.
People start to withdraw their money.
Pretty soon it is financially shaky.
You can make banks fail.
Bzzt. I've already done that. Maybe you've heard about a few? Think bigger.
Stock market?
Yes.
Currency market?
Yes.
Commodities market?
Yes.
Small countries?
no more rich people, no more poor people, everybody's the same. Isn't that what we said we always wanted?
Cos, you haven't gone crazy on me, have you?
Fellas, Janek's little black box is on his desk between the pencil jar and the lamp.
Uh, Whistler, I hate to tell you this, but you're blind.

Okay, boss, this LTX-71 concealable mike is part of the same system that NASA used when they faked the Apollo Moon landings. They had the astronauts broadcast around the world from a sound stage at Norton Air Force Base in San Bernadino, California. So it worked for them, shouldn't give us too many problems.
[asking each team member what they'll do with their share of the money]
Carl?

[helium voice]
I'd like to have a deep relationship with a beautiful woman who melts from the very first time our eyes meet.
[others laughing]
We're not getting paid that much, Carl.
Well, you know, someone like Liz.
We're definitely not getting paid that much.
That was very good, Bish. Remind me to make you an honorary blind person.
Hi, my name is Werner Brandes. My voice is my passport. Verify Me.
If I come in with what I know, can you guarantee my safety?
Do you have the item?
No.
Fifteen seconds.
Can you guarantee my safety?
Where is the item?

[more emphatic]
Can you guarantee my safety?
Hey, that's not easy, what I just did!
They've even got photos of the guy leaving the embassy, through the back service entrance. Hey, Crease, you on?
Yeah, I'm on.
Were you still in C.I.A. in '72?
Yeah, why?
Did you know the Deputy Director of Planning was down in Managua, Nicaragua the day before the earthquake?
Now what are you saying, the C.I.A. caused the Managua earthquake?
Well, I can't prove it, but...
"Give him head"?
"Be a beacon"?
[last lines]

In a surprise announcement, the Republican National Committee has revealed it is bankrupt. A spokesman for the party said they had plenty of money in their accounts last week, but today they just don't know where the money has gone. But not everybody is going begging. Amnesty International, Greenpeace and the United Negro College Fund announced record earnings this week, due mostly to large, anonymous donations.
[Martin has to walk across Cosmo's office at two inches per second to avoid triggering the motion sensors; outside, Werner arrives with Liz]

[on radio]
Martin? I think you'd better hurry.

[through his teeth]
The one thing I *can't* do is hurry.

[re-arranging Scrabble letters]
SETEC ASTRONOMY... TOO MANY SECRETS.
[during the team's surveillance of Dr. Janek, they hear his girlfriend passionately making out with him]

[instantly]
Mr. Bishop, do you mind if I take a look?
Carl!

[pushing Carl away]
Grow up.
[taps Martin on the shoulder]

[whispers]
Let me see.
It's fascinating what fifty bucks will get you at the county recorder's office.
What have you got?
Playtronics Corporate Headquarters, the complete blueprints.
Not bad. Not bad, Carl.
Well, thanks.
Where'd you get the fifty bucks?
Took it from Mother's wallet.
Good.
We got bupkis! We turn ourselves in now, they'll give us twenty years in the electric chair!
Now what are you saying, the NSA killed Kennedy?
No, they shot him but they didn't kill him. He's still alive.
[Gordon tells Bishop a scientist has gotten $380,000 from Russia]
Gimme a break. We won, they lost, you know? It's been in a couple of the papers.

But the key meeting took place July 3rd, 1958, when the Air Force brought the space visitor to the White House for an interview with President Eisenhower. And Ike said, "hey look, give us your technology, we'll give you all the cow lips you want."
There isn't a government on this planet that wouldn't kill us all for that thing.
[Mother walks into the room and triggers the motion sensor]
This is what's in Cosmo's office. Best motion sensor on the market.
And watch this.
[he breathes in front of the sensor, and it goes off]
Also responds to thermal differentials.
Does this have a happy ending?

Oh, yeah. We can wrap you in a full-body suit of neoprene, heat-resistant rubber. Or we can raise the temperature in Cosmo's office to 98.6 degrees - which is probably what we'll have to do, because the neoprene would suffocate you. Either way, you've got a top speed of two inches per second. Any faster than that...
[alarm beeps]
and, uh, big guys with guns. But you'll probably do fine.
Since when am I the one who's...

This is the same model answering machine that Janek used for the shell of his box, now that's what you'll be carrying across the room at two inches per second. I got that for you because I figured you'd just, you know, want to practice. Remember to go real slow!
Slow.
[looks at Crease]
You get all the *fun* stuff...
Martin Brice - my old and good friend who promised me we would not get in trouble and who, I might add, did not.
The man who folded this tube of Crest is looking for someone meticulous, refined. Anal.
[everyone turns around]
What?
I'm sorry if he hurt you. I'm afraid Wallace doesn't like you very much.
You oughta have that guy checked for rabies.
Rabies occurs only in warm-blooded animals.
I'm sorry. It's just, I have this work.

[pushes him down and tears open her blouse]
I'll give you something to work, baby!
OK. Just for a little while.

[kisses him and closes the window blinds]
Oh, Gunter!
[Bishop and his team are spying on Dr. Gunter Janek]

[panting and moaning]
Oh! Gunter! Oh, Gunter! Let's do what we did in Mexico City! Oh, Gunter...
Huh. I didn't know you could do *that* in Mexico City.
So, people hire you to break into their places... to make sure no one can break into their places?
It's a living.
Not a very good one.
Before we begin, something we need to clear up. Most firms of this kind are staffed with ex-law enforcement types, but your team, it's...

[laughs]
I know, kind of different.
Yes, you are.
[opens file]
Darryl Roscow, also known as "Mother." Eighteen months at Denimmoore for breaking and entering.
Yeah, he was framed. But he's got the best hands in the business.

[opens another file]
Carl Arbogast, age 19. Caught breaking into the Oakland City School District computer to change his grades.
I know, we're the ones who caught him.

[another file]
Erwin Emory, also known as "Whistler."
Yeah, yeah, I know, he had a little trouble with the phone company...
Sixty-two counts?
All right, you want law enforcement? What about Donald Crease? Twenty-two year veteran of the CIA.
Terminated, 1987. Why was that?
I don't know, I think maybe a personality conflict. Who are you guys?
Relax, Marty. We have to check on these things. It's just that every member of your team has had some kind of problem in their past.

[opens another file]
Then there's Martin Bishop...
[after a tense silence, he tilts the folder, showing it is empty]
He doesn't seem to have a past.
Anybody want to shut down the Federal Reserve?
Anybody want to black out New England?

[Dr. Brandes is cooking for Liz]
It's hot in here. Maybe I'll just open this window a little bit.
I'll join you as soon as I'm through pounding these breasts.
[Carl's demand is to date the young N.S.A. agent]
How 'bout a lunch? You can chaperone.
No! I will not *do this*!
[Abbott's agents are holding back a burst of laughter]
Hey, Abby. Abby, come on now! The FBI'd give him twins.
NO!
Who else is going to change the world, Marty? Greenpeace?
You will give me the box, right now, or I will kill you, right now.
[Mother (the conspiracy theorist) is reading a tabloid]
Cattle mutilations are up.
Don't.
Sorry.
You guys'll be chalk outlines without me.
Uh, could we maybe just go back to the "they might kill us" part?
"Cultural Attache."
Unbelievable.
Last few years has been very confusing for people in my line of work.

Anyway, I couldn't have you talking to the Russians. Five years ago, yes, we could trust them not to go running to the F.B.I., or if they did we could trust the F.B.I. not to believe them, but today we can't trust anybody.
It would be a breakthrough of Gaussian proportions and allow us to acquire the solution in a dramatically more efficient manner.
I leave message here on service but you do not call.
Martin, you'll do not know who to trust!
No more secrets, Marty.
Richard Nixon's personal checking account is in here!
Oh, this is a challenge. Marty, we have to find someone truly worthy to give his money to.
How about... the National Organization to Legalize Marijuana?
Perfect!
How's the audio?
Good, Mother's pretty close.
He's just wearing four safety belts this time.
What, no parachute?
Oh no!
What...? Don't say, "Oh no."
[Crease and Mother are being held at gunpoint by two guards]
Did I ever tell you why I had to leave the CIA?
No...
My temper.
[Behind the guards, Whistler throws the van into reverse. One of the guards spins around to look, and Crease grabs his shotgun and knocks out both guards]
Wow...
Motherfuckers mess with me, I'll split your head!
I'm getting too old for this.
Anybody want to crash a couple of passenger jets?
Pain? Try Aspirin.
[repeated line]
The government took my home.
I can't believe we actually made it back.
I can't believe we pulled off the greatest sneak in history and can't tell anybody about it.
You know what I can't believe? I can't believe tomorrow's Thursday!
[while infiltrating Janek's office, his girlfriend enters unexpectedly; Martin grabs her, and in the van the others hear muffled screams]
Who the hell is that?
Battle stations!
